TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ContainerControlDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides designer functionality for controls that contain child controls or properties that can be modified at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class provides a base designer class for controls that can be modified on the design surface. This includes controls that contain child controls or editable inner properties. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> provides a single framed region to represent the control, and automatically handles rendering the control at design time.
Apply the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> attribute on the associated control to determine the design-time behavior of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner>. Apply the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> settings on the associated control as follows:
- `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> represents the contents of the editable design region as child controls.
- `true` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> represents the contents of the editable design region as editable inner properties of the control.
Control developers can derive and extend a custom designer from one of several base designers depending on the kind of control that is being developed, as defined in the following list:
- Controls that allow child controls to be added to it at design time can derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.PanelContainerDesigner> class is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class and represents a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel> control on the design surface.
- Controls that have one or more child controls, and might also have an editable designer region where controls can be added at design time, can derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner> class.
- Controls that require custom design-time processing can derive from the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner> class.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class replaces the obsolete <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ReadWriteControlDesigner> class.
Use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute to associate a custom designer class together with a custom control implementation. For detailed information about how to use control designers with custom controls, see [Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/27e44af0-6e12-4b7d-b17f-db35f1b6a052).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to derive a designer class from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class. The example defines a simple control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl> class, and then defines an associated designer, which is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class. The derived designer class overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> properties to customize the frame that is around the editable region of the control on the design surface.
[!code-csharp[SimpleContainerControlDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SimpleContainerControlDesigner/CS/simplecontainercontrol.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SimpleContainerControlDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/SimpleContainerControlDesigner/VB/simplecontainercontrol.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddDesignTimeCssAttributes(class System.Collections.IDictionary styleAttributes) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub AddDesignTimeCssAttributes (styleAttributes As IDictionary)
abstract member AddDesignTimeCssAttributes : System.Collections.IDictionary -> unit override this.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes : System.Collections.IDictionary -> unit

Docs.param: A keyed collection of style attributes.
Docs.summary: Adds the style attributes for the control at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method adds a set of style attributes for the design-time representation of the control. The style attribute values are added to the `styleAttributes` collection, keyed by the style attribute name. For example, you can access the height value in the collection as `styleAttributes["height"]` for C# or `styleAttributes("height")` for Microsoft Visual Basic.
If the associated control is not derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.AddDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method does not add attribute values to the `styleAttributes` collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property AllowResize As Boolean
public: virtual property bool AllowResize { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating if the control can be resized at design time.
Docs.value: , if the control can be resized; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The base implementation for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.AllowResize%2A> property returns `true`. This indicates that the designer supports resizing of the control on the design surface.

block.para: Classes that are derived from the class can override the property to indicate that the designer does not support resizing of the control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property FrameCaption As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ FrameCaption { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the caption that is displayed for a control at design time.
Docs.value: The string used for the control frame caption at design time, if the control has a design-time caption; otherwise, an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.FrameCaption%2A> string is the caption that is displayed in the frame around the editable region of the control on the design surface.
The default caption for a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> frame is the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ID%2A> property of the designer instance. This is typically the same as the run-time <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property of the control.

block.para: You can set a different frame caption for a control designer by deriving a class from the class, and then overriding the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property FrameStyle As Style
public: virtual property System::Web::UI::WebControls::Style ^ FrameStyle { System::Web::UI::WebControls::Style ^ get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the style that is applied to the control frame at design time.
Docs.value: A for the control frame at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.FrameStyle%2A> property indicates the style properties of the frame around the editable region of the control on the design surface.

block.para: When deriving a class from the class, override the property to change the properties of the frame, such as the border, foreground color, background color, and caption font settings.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IDictionary GetDesignTimeCssAttributes() cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetDesignTimeCssAttributes () As IDictionary
abstract member GetDesignTimeCssAttributes : unit -> System.Collections.IDictionary override this.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes : unit -> System.Collections.IDictionary

Docs.summary: Returns the collection of style attributes for the control at design time.
Docs.returns: A collection of style attributes applied to the control on the design surface. The style attribute names are keys used to access the style attribute values in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method returns a collection of style attributes for the design-time representation of the control.
To examine a style attribute value at design time for a control, use the style attribute name as a key to the returned collection. Style attribute values are stored as strings in the collection. For example, you can access the height value in the collection as `styleAttributes["height"]` for C# or `styleAttributes("height")` for Microsoft Visual Basic.
If the associated control is not derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeCssAttributes%2A> method returns an empty collection.

block.para: The default implementation for the method initializes the style attribute collection by using the method. To manipulate styles in a control designer that are derived from the class, override the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDesignTimeHtml (regions As DesignerRegionCollection) As String

Docs.summary: Returns the HTML markup that is used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: An HTML markup string that represents the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%28System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection%29> method to get the HTML for the control. Child controls that are contained in the editable design region are rendered using their associated control designers.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%28System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection%29> method initializes a new <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion> object for the editable region of associated control, and then returns the region through the `regions` collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetEditableDesignerRegionContent (region As EditableDesignerRegion) As String

Docs.param: An editable design region contained within the control.
Docs.summary: Returns the content for the editable region of the control at design time.
Docs.returns: The persisted content of the region contained within the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class implements a single designer region instead of a collection of designer regions. Therefore, the `region` parameter is ignored, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method returns the content for the single designer region that is contained in the control designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetPersistenceContent() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetPersistenceContent () As String

Docs.summary: Returns the persistable content of the control at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.GetPersistenceContent%2A> method returns `null` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class does not have persisted inner content.

Docs.param: An editable design region contained within the control.
Content to assign for the editable design region.
Docs.summary: Sets the content for the editable region of the control at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner> class implements a single designer region instead of a collection of designer regions. Therefore, the `region` parameter is ignored, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ContainerControlDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> method sets the content for the single designer region that is contained in the control designer.
